articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Concert of KPA Brass Band
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Concert of KPA Brass Band
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, guided a concert of the brass band of the KPA.
					 The creators and musicians of the band were overcome with immense excitement and joy as they were greatly honored and happy to receive guidance from the Supreme Commander for the third time this year alone. 
					
					 When he appeared in auditorium together with his wife Ri Sol Ju amid the playing of welcome music, the audience broke into rousing cheers of "hurrah!" shaking the theatre.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA Vice Marshal Hyon Yong Chol, chief of the KPA General Staff, Jang Song Thaek, vice-chairman of the NDC, KPA Generals Choe Pu Il, Pak Jae Gyong and Kim Yong Chol, KPA Lieut. General Pak Jong Chon, Hwang Pyong So, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and KPA service personnel.
					
					 Put on the stage were wind music "Let Our Party Flag Flutter Vigorously," "The General Is the Banner of Victory" and "Song of the Korean People's Army," "Advance," "Song of Coastal Artillerymen" and "Leader, Just Give Us Your Order" and foreign songs "On Waves" and "Sword Dance."
					
					 The performers represented with great pride the militant spirit and invincible might of the heroic KPA, which is devotedly defending the party and the leader, the country and its people by inheriting the brilliant traditions of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle with solemn echo and cheerful and appealing melody.
					
					 At the end of the concert, the performers and the audience enthusiastically cheered the Supreme Commander.
					
					 He set forth the tasks facing the brass band and gave precious instructions on implementing them, saying that the revolutionary and militant brass band instills the conviction of sure victory in the revolution, optimism, burning hatred for the enemies and the will to annihilate them into all service personnel and people.
					
					 Only when the brass band arranges and plays dynamic and cheerful songs as melodies played by it are marches, can it stir up the spirit of the army and people.
					
					 If a contest among the brass bands of the KPA is organized, it will help swap good experience in playing and creative activities and raise the rendition skill in that course, he said, giving an instruction to hold a contest every year.
					
					 The KPA brass band is a symbol and face of the powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu, he noted, underscoring the need to further develop the rendition skill and style in a Korean way and provide it with better uniforms so that it may play military music replete with mental power and spirit of the KPA.
					
					  Hearing the mere words of military music makes one feel strength surging up and wherever military music is heard, courage is displayed and feats are performed, he said.
					
					 When listening to wind music "Song of the Korean People's Army," in particular, one cannot but be excited, he said, adding when the day of the great war for national reunification comes in the future, the KPA will advance to the tune of the revolutionary military music played by the KPA brass band.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the creators and musicians of the KPA brass band would conduct activities for creation and playing, deeply aware of their honorable tasks, and thus further develop the KPA brass band into a world-class one and powerfully encourage the service personnel and people in a worthwhile advance toward a final victory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of O Ik Je
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of O Ik Je
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of O Ik Je, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Sunday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: O Ik Je Dies
articles.content:
O Ik Je Dies
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- O Ik Je, vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea and advisor to the Central Guidance Committee of the Chondoist Association of Korea, died of illness at the age of 83 on September 1, 2012.
					 An obituary of O Ik Je was issued by the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea and the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Sunday.
					
					 According to it, O was a patriot who dedicated himself to democracy in the south Korean society and the reunification of the country.
					
					 Born in Taegok-ri, Hoechang County of South Phyongan Province in the period of the Japanese imperialist colonial rule over Korea, he grew, subject to all sorts of national contempt as a member of the stateless nation, from his childhood. After the liberation of Korea he worked as an official of Chondoism in his hometown.
					
					 He was conscripted to serve in the disgraceful "ROK Army."
					
					 In the subsequent period he conducted positive activities for the democratization of the south Korean society, affiliated to religious and political circles and dissident pro-reunification organizations.  He came into the care of the DPRK in August of 1997, disillusioned with the corrupt south Korean society where the sovereignty and dignity of the nation are wantonly violated and fascist dictatorship rides roughshod.
					
					 He worked hard for national reconciliation, unity and reunification as vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea and deputy to the 11th and 12th-term Supreme People's Assembly.
					
					 He devoted all his wisdom and energies to the sacred cause of national reunification till the last moments of his life, prompted by his single desire to live up to the profound loving care and trust of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Talks Held between Kim Yong Nam and Mahmoud Ahmadinejad
articles.content:
Talks Held between Kim Yong Nam and Mahmoud Ahmadinejad
						
Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, held talks with Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, at the Presidential Palace on Sept. 1.
					At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issues of boosting the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation and strengthening cooperation on the joint anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. front and in the non-aligned movement. They reached a consensus of views on the matters discussed.
					
					The DPRK side clarified that it is the firm stand of the DPRK to boost ties with Iran.
					
					The DPRK side underscored the need to boost the exchange of visits by high-level delegations, ties of economic cooperation and mutual support in the international arena in line with the development level of bilateral political relations. It called for significantly celebrating the 40th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations.
					
					The Iranian side expressed satisfaction with the intensified cooperation in various domains in the past, adding that the development of the bilateral relations is beneficial for the wellbeing and development in Iran and DPRK.
					
					Urging all the member states of the NAM to bear in mind that they could defeat imperialism and hegemony when they struggle from a steadfast anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. stand like the DPRK, the Iranian side stressed that the issue of Korea's reunification should be resolved independently by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation.
					
					The talks took place in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: MOU Signed between DPRK and Iran
articles.content:
MOU Signed between DPRK and Iran
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- MOU on cooperation in science, technology and education between the governments of the DPRK and Iran was signed in Tehran on Saturday.
					 Present at the signing-ceremony from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, DPRK Ambassador to Iran Jo In Chol and other suite members and from the Iranian side President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, Fereydoon Abbasi-Dabani, vice-president and concurrently head of Atomic Energy Organization, Ahmad Vahidi, minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics, Mehdi Ghazanfari, minister of Industrial, Mining and Trade, Kamran Daneshjoo, minister of Science, Research and Technology, the minister of Agriculture and the governor of the Central Bank and officials concerned. 
					
					 Pak Ui Chun and Kamran Daneshjoo signed the MOU.

articles.title: Welcome Function for Kim Yong Nam Held in Iran
articles.content:
Welcome Function for Kim Yong Nam Held in Iran
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for welcoming Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on an official goodwill visit to the Islamic Republic of Iran took place at the Presidential Palace on Saturday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, DPRK Ambassador in Tehran Jo In Chol and other suite members.
					
					 Attending it were Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, Fereydoon Abbasi-Dabani, vice-president and concurrently head of Atomic Energy Organization, Ahmad Vahidi, minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics, Mehdi Ghazanfari, minister of Industrial, Mining and Trade, Kamran Daneshjoo, minister of Science, Research and Technology and relevant figures.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and Mahmoud Ahmadinejad reviewed guards of honor of the three services of the Iranian army.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-President and Speaker of Iran
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-President and Speaker of Iran
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, separately met and had a talk with Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, first vice-president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, and Ali Larijani, speaker of the Iranian Majlis, at the Presidential Palace and the building of Majlis on Saturday.
					 The first vice-president said that he was pleased with the economic achievements made by the Korean people under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, adding that the DPRK was the first to recognize the Islamic Revolution of Iran and rendered unsparing support and aid to the Iranian people.
					
					 Saying that the Iranian people respect the heroic Korean people and attach importance to the development of the relations between the two countries, he expressed his intention to further expand economic cooperation in the future.
					
					 The speaker said that the relations between Iran and the DPRK have achieved good and multifaceted development, underscoring the need to strengthen the support and solidarity between the parliaments of the two countries in the international arena.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Pays Courtesy Call on Seyed Ali Khamenei
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Pays Courtesy Call on Seyed Ali Khamenei
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday paid a courtesy call on Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran.
					 Seyed Ali Khamenei said that he did not forget the fact that he was honored with the audience of President Kim Il Sung during his visit to the DPRK.
					
					 He praised Kim Il Sung as the great statesman.
					
					 He has a good knowledge of the greatness of leader Kim Jong Il, saying that the dear respected Kim Jong Un is carrying forward the cause of the preceding leaders.
					
					 He is rejoiced over the ongoing close cooperation between the two countries, he said.
					
					 He wished the Korean people happiness and prosperity.
					
					 The talk proceeded in a cordial atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Pays Courtesy Call on Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Pays Courtesy Call on Iranian President
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday paid a courtesy call on Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
					 Kim Yong Nam conveyed greetings from the dear respected Kim Jong Un to the Iranian president.
					
					 The president expressed deep thanks for this and asked Kim Yong Nam to convey his sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The talk proceeded in a cordial atmosphere.

articles.title: Iranian President Hosts Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Iranian President Hosts Banquet for Kim Yong Nam
						
 Tehran, September 2 (KCNA) -- Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, gave a banquet in honor of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Nam, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, DPRK Ambassador in Tehran Jo In Chol and other suite members.
					
					 Attending it were Fereydoon Abbasi-Dabani, vice-president and head of Atomic Energy Organization, Ahmad Vahidi, minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics, Mehdi Ghazanfari, minister of Industrial, Mining and Trade, Kamran Daneshjoo, minister of Science, Research and Technology, the minister of Agriculture, the governor of the Central Bank of Iran and officials concerned.
					
					 The banquet was given in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Guinean President Wishes for Korean People's Success in Their Struggle
articles.content:
Guinean President Wishes for Korean People's Success in Their Struggle
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jun Gap, DPRK ambassador to Guinea, presented his credentials to Guinean President Alpha Conde on August 29.
					 At the meeting the president wished the Korean people greater success in building a thriving nation and accomplishing the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung rendered disinterested aid to the Guinean government and people in their drive for building a new society, he said, stressing:
					
					 The Guinean government is convinced that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries with long historical traditions would continue to develop in all domains in the future, too.

articles.title: Nigerian Personage Pays Visit to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Nigerian Personage Pays Visit to DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, paid a visit to the DPRK embassy in Abuja on August 22 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 He laid a bunch of flowers before the full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the name of the Juche idea followers in Nigeria and made a bow to them.
					
					 He praised Kim Jong Il for pursuing the Songun politics to reliably protect people-centered Korean socialism from all aggression moves of imperialists.
					
					 The Korean people will surely accomplish the Juche cause, Songun revolutionary cause, as they hold the dear respected Kim Jong Un identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he stressed.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of Kim Po Hyon, grandfather of President Kim Il Sung, in Mangyongdae Sunday on the 57th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen there was a wreath from Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at a wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Jong Gak, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Pyong Sam, and others, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and in the fields of education and publication and working people in the city.
					
					 Placed before the grave were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, military universities, educational and publication organs and party and power organs, farms and others in the city.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Po Hyon, looking back on his noble life in which he encouraged his family members to embark on the road of the revolutionary struggle with ardent patriotism and noble traits and devoted his all to the country and people.

articles.title: 8th Pyongyang Int'l Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
8th Pyongyang Int'l Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition will be held at the Grand People's Study House from September 10 to 12.
					 The exhibition will bring together many organizations from different countries and regions of the world and international bodies. 
					
					 There will be on display books and data on latest science and technology. 
					
					 The exhibition will contribute to developing exchange of science and technology and cooperation among countries.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Most Ardent Patriotism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Most Ardent Patriotism
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Building the might of the country means providing political, ideological, military and economic foundations and potentials to firmly defend and develop the country despite any storm and stress of history, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a by-lined article.
					 Only when a country has its own strength, can it build itself in line with its own line and strategy and develop everything as it pleases, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It is necessary to build strength to defend the country and usher in an era of national prosperity in all fields, political, military, economic and cultural.
					
					 Independence is, needless to say, dearest to the country and the nation.
					
					 It is the dearest patriotism to protect independence while building the strength to guarantee it amounts to the most ardent patriotism.
					
					 It is of greater importance to work for the future of the country to build one's own strength. It is the most ardent patriotism to build strength to make one's country prosper and develop forever.
					
					 The course of building national power by the concerted efforts of the nation means the course of giving full play to the mental power of the nation. Nothing is surer guarantee than the might of self-reliance in bringing earlier a final victory and a bright future.
					
					 Those descendants of the nation who failed to build their own strength in the world where the imperialists' law of jungle is rampant are fated to be members of a stateless nation.
					
					 It is the lesson taught by history that it is necessary for any country and nation to firmly build their own strength as long as there is imperialism.
					
					 Those people who have firmly built their strength can have firm trust in the eternal rosy future of their countries.
					
					 It is thanks to the powerful national power that the army and people of the DPRK are dynamically advancing, full of confidence of victory in the drive for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The gains won by dint of self-reliance precisely mean such weight of the national power of Songun Korea.

articles.title: Provocateurs Are Doomed to Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Provocateurs Are Doomed to Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) --The Lee Myung Bak Group has resorted to frantic political and military provocations to do harm to the DPRK in collusion with outside forces after derailing all the north-south dialogues and cooperation. It has now become undisguised in its moves to ignite a war against the DPRK as its office is nearing its end.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It is the necessity of history that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces obsessed with aggression and war are bound to meet final destruction, it says.
					
					 The article cites facts to prove this.
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					 In the last Korean War, the U.S. imperialists perpetrated a surprise armed invasion against the young DPRK by mobilizing the Syngman Rhee puppet clique and mercenaries of satellite countries. However, the aggressors suffered a miserable defeat in face of the heroic struggle waged by the army and the people of the DPRK all out in the sacred war of justice.
					
					 The U.S. armed spy ship "Pueblo" incident and large spy plane "EC-121" incident which took place against the backdrop of ceaseless armed provocations of warmongers at home and abroad in the post-war period ended in the surrender of the U.S.
					
					 In the 1990s, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces worked hard to ignite an all-out war against the DPRK while talking about "nuclear inspection". But the enemies were hard hit by the DPRK's solemn proclamation of a semi-war state and its statement declaring the withdrawal from the NPT.
					
					 Much upset by this, the U.S. signed the DPRK-U.S. agreed framework and the U.S. president sent even a message of assurances to the DPRK.
					
					 In the new century, too, the DPRK has won victory after victory in the ceaseless confrontation and the U.S. and the puppet forces suffered bitter setbacks one after another. 
					
					 If the enemies fire even a single shell on the territory of the DPRK, this will not be confined to a local war but lead to a sacred war for the country's reunification.
					
					 The chance of provocation sought by the U.S. imperialists and the puppet warmongers will only prove to be a time to meet self-destruction as it will precipitate their final end.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Can Not Flee from Responsibility for Grave Situation on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Can Not Flee from Responsibility for Grave Situation on Korean Peninsula: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean war maniacs staged Ulji Freedom Guardian large-scale joint military exercises targeting the DPRK from August 20 to 31. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined commentary terms the war gamble an open wreckage of peace and a reckless action driving the situation close to the brink of war.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces examined the operational preparations in a comprehensive way to invade the DPRK by force of arms under the signboard of what they call "provocation deterrence," it says, and continues:
					
					 The U.S. worked out a new defence strategy of attaching importance to Asia and set the DPRK as the first target in its implementation. It has already finished off the strategic deployment of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea and in its vicinity, task force in its mainland and other armed forces and war equipment so that they may carry out military operations against the DPRK any moment. The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in league with its American master examined and completed the preparations to provoke a new war as a whole. What remains to be done for them is to ignite a war. 
					
					 It is the U.S. imperialists and the Lee group of traitors that threaten the DPRK and countries in its vicinity with military provocations and war moves.
					
					 With nothing can they cover up their hostile nature. Nor can they flee from the responsibility for the greatest danger of nuclear war on the peninsula.

articles.title: Ro Su Hui's Visit to Pyongyang Is Not Guilty: S. Korean Figure
articles.content:
Ro Su Hui's Visit to Pyongyang Is Not Guilty: S. Korean Figure
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Thongil News posted an article titled "Mourner's visit to the north is not guilty" contributed by Kwon O Hon, honorary chairman of the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy on August 28.
					 The article said: The prosecution arrested Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), for visiting Pyongyang to attend the commemorations of the 100th day since the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and detained and prosecuted Won Jin Uk, secretary general of the headquarters on charge of the violation of the draconic "Security Law."
					
					 The authorities' unethical human rights abuses and brutal crackdown upon the South Headquarters of Pomminryon standing in van of the reunification movement are a natural product of their moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots, it noted, and continued:
					
					 Ro's visit to Pyongyang to express condolences over the great loss to the nation can never be considered as a crime as it was a righteous deed to fulfill his duty in response to the desire and will of all Koreans for peace and independent reunification of the country and their patriotic call. 
					
					 The article urged the authorities to unconditionally release the unreasonably arrested members of the headquarters and abolish at once the SL, a law against reunification and human rights.

articles.title: Comprehensive Reinvestigation into Cause of Cheonan Warship Sinking Urged
articles.content:
Comprehensive Reinvestigation into Cause of Cheonan Warship Sinking Urged
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Kim So Gu, director of the Earthquake Institute of south Korea, contributed a paper on the sinking of warship "Cheonan" to an international academic magazine. 
					 He in his paper claimed that it is great possibility that "Cheonan" sank not because of a torpedo of the north but due to underwater explosion of a mine left by the south Korean navy in the 1970s. 
					
					 He said he could draw this conclusion on the basis of an analysis of shock waves, sound waves in the air and underwater waves at the time of the incident.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Reinvestigation is necessary because the results of the investigation into the Cheonan incident announced by the civilian and military joint investigation team failed to carefully deal with the nature of underwater explosion and dynamics. 
					
					 The Solidarity for Social Progress of south Korea issued a commentary on August 28 in this regard.
					
					 His paper totally refuted the results of investigation announced by the "government" in which it claimed "Cheonan" was sunken by the torpedo attack of the north, the commentary said, and went on:
					
					 There were strong voices critical of the "government's" irresponsible investigation and acts to hide the truth about the incident and opposition to the results of investigation was repeatedly expressed in the meantime.
					
					 Nevertheless, the "government" completely suspended the south-north exchange by pursuing a policy of pressure upon the north including "May 24 step" while seeking political aims, not making any effort to clearly probe truth and thus steadily escalated the military tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak took the lead in kicking up a coloring ruckus against those people who put just questions.
					
					 There should be a comprehensive reinvestigation into the cause of the warship incident, the commentary concluded.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in South Africa, Peru
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in South Africa, Peru
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" were held by the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa and Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Peru on Aug. 23.
					 Eddie Kekana, chairman of the South African group, said he was pleased to hold a seminar on Kim Jong Un's work, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Un made public a series of works this year, clarifying his will to carry forward and develop the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 His work instilled conviction of victory to the Korean people to overcome with sorrow over the loss of Kim Jong Il in whom they believed as in Heaven and proved the justice of the socialist cause and clearly indicated the path for the world progressives to follow.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly build a rich and powerful country and the world socialist cause will steadily advance along the orbit of independence as long as they are under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Guillermo Alcazar Ribera, chairman of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said it was a great honor and pleasure not only for the Korean people but for the progressive political parties and organizations and people of Peru to receive the work of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The large-scale joint war drills of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces are nothing but bubble for the Korean people who are embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 I am sure that under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un who has creditably carried forward Kim Jong Il's idea and leadership the Korean people will win final victory in building a thriving nation, achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the cause of independence against imperialism by embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Aniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Observed in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Sankt Peterburg of Russia, Minsk of Belarus and Karachi of Pakistan on August 22 and 25 on the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Present there were figures of the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism, the Russian Society for Promoting the Study and Dissemination of Comrade Kim Jong Il's Works, Kim Jong Suk Women’s Union of Russia, the Russian Youth Association for the Study of the Songun Policy, the February 16 Youth Society for the Study of Juche Idea and Songun Politics of Belarus, the Pakistan People's Party, the Pakistan Trade Union Federation, the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan, the Karachi Juche Study Center of Pakistan and the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, and masses.
					
					 The chairperson of the Kim Jong Suk Women’s Union of Russia praised Kim Jong Il for making journeys for Songun leadership till the last moments of his life for the country, revolution and people.
					
					 The chairman of the February 16 Youth Society for the Study of Juche Idea and Songun Politics of Belarus lauded the immortal Songun feats performed by Kim Jong Il and the dear respected   Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The secretary general of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan and other speakers referred in detail to the essence and invincible might of the Songun politics.
					
					 Noting that thanks to Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the Juche revolutionary cause, the Songun revolutionary cause is making a victorious advance, they expressed belief that the DPRK's drive for building a thriving nation and its struggle for achieving national reunification will be crowned with victory at an early date under his wise leadership. 
					
					 At those seminars the messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries from Aug. 17 to 25 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 They included a Korean cultural and art exhibition in Shanghai, China, and Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions in Serpukhov City of Moscow Region, Russia and San Isidro District, Lima City, Peru and Sao Paulo State, Brazil. 
					
					 On display in the venues were photos on the Songun revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerless great persons, books introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with wisdom and skills of Koreans.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremonies of those exhibitions were figures of all social standings and masses of relevant countries.
					
					 The curator of a library in Shanghai City said the peoples of China and Korea have deep and traditional friendship, hoping for more brisk cultural exchange between the two countries in the days ahead.
					
					 A vice mayor of Serpukhov City of Moscow Region, Russia and the curator of the History and Art Museum in Serpukhov City noted the DPRK emerged an invincible powerful state under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The governor of San Isidro District of Lima City, Peru said he was pleased with the holding of the exhibition on the significant occasion, expressing belief that the DPRK would further prosper as desired by its preceding leaders.
					
					 The international secretary of the Brazilian Communist Party said witnessing the Korean people's drive for building a thriving nation, he came to have firm confidence of the future of socialism. 
					
					 The Brazilian Communist Party will always stand by the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in the common struggle against imperialism in future, too, he declared.

articles.title: British Organizations Support Korean People's Will for National Reunification
articles.content:
British Organizations Support Korean People's Will for National Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on August 25. It supported the statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK foreign ministry and the statement by the Panmunjom mission of the Korean People's Army as regards the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities.
					 UFG is an explicit threat to the DPRK in view of its nature and scale and aimed to pull down socialist Korea, the statement said. It went on:
					
					 The statement of the KPA Panmunjom mission which declared that the DPRK will no longer be bound to the Korean Armistice Agreement as the U.S. wantonly violated it is very just.
					
					 The DPRK in the afore-said statements clarified its will to deal a deadly blow to the U.S. imperialists, if they commit a provocation against the DPRK, and achieve national reunification, supreme desire of Koreans.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un frightened the imperialists through his inspection to island defence detachments stationed in the southernmost hotspot area on the southwestern sector of the front.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists, sworn enemy of the Korean people and progressive mankind, should be cleared away.
					
					 The Korean people would defeat the U.S. imperialists and surely achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: British Organization Praises Songun Revolutionary Cause
articles.content:
British Organization Praises Songun Revolutionary Cause
						
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The British branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a statement on August 25 on the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership through his field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960 which was a brilliant succession to the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung, the statement said.
					
					 It praised the President for founding the Korean People's Revolutionary Army after acquiring deep insight into the truth that Koreans should hold arms in their hands to advance the Korean revolution and liberate the country and developing it into a powerful Juche-based armed forces.
					
					 Thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK has turned into the Juche power with the capability for self-defence and the Korean people protected socialism from provocations and threats by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet clique and achieved great successes in the building of an economic power, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 The Songun revolutionary cause of Juche has been successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It hoped the Korean people under the guidance of Kim Jong Un would make greater achievement in their struggle.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto O Ik Je

Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto O Ik Je
						
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 2 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto O Ik Je, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige Fabrica de Azulejo Taedonggang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige Fabrica de Azulejo Taedonggang
						
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Azulejo Taedonggang cuya capacidad fue ampliada. 
					El Mariscal recorrio vario lugares de la fabrica cerciorandose del estado de construccion, el funcionamiento de los equipos y la produccion. 
					
					Ante todo, estuvo en la sede de produccion donde se encuentra el taller de microlito con capacidad productiva de cientos de miles de metros cuadrados, el taller de azulejo de marmol artificial, etc. 
					
					Vio detalladamente el proceso de produccion de azulejo de marmol artificial de gran tamano con color y dibujo iguales al marmol natural. 
					
					Hizo conocimiento detallado del funcionamiento de los equipos de punta que graban diversos dibujos y decoraciones en los azulejos compuestos de vidrio y los productos de construccion. 
					
					Aprecio mucho a los funcionarios y empleados que en pleno acato al legado del Dirigente y al proposito del partido enviaron los azulejos y tejas de distintos tipos a los campos de construccion de importantes objetos como la avenida Changjon, y al mismo tiempo, terminaron con exito la segunda etapa de la obra de ampliacion de capacidad haciendo gran aporte a elevar el nivel autoctono, moderno y cientifico de la industria de materiales de construccion. 
					
					Averiguo el proceso automatizado de produccion en cadena en la sala de mando general donde se puede conocer de una mirada el estado de produccion segun las computadoras. 
					
					El Mariscal escucho con satisfaccion el parte de los funcionarios de que la fabrica se basa en las materias primas criollas y la calcinacion de azulejo tambien se realiza por la gasificacion de carbon abundante en nuestro pais. 
					
					El nivel cualitativo de azulejo se determina por el limite de tolerancia de plano y angulo recto, la tasa de contraccion, la intensidad y la resistencia al frio, dijo y apunto la necesidad de seguir concentrando la fuerza en elevar la calidad de los productos. 
					
					Acto seguido, el Mariscal recorrio los talleres de azulejo de pared exterior y exterior, de suelo, y de marmol. 
					
					Viendo los azulejos de diferentes colores y tamanos, dijo con satisfaccion que al comparar con los vestidos, son todas de nuestros tanto las ropas interiores como las exteriores. 
					
					El Mariscal paso revista a la exposicion de azulejos en el recinto de la fabrica. 
					
					A traves del recorrido por la fabrica, pude conocer que los funcionarios de aqui trabajan con audacia con el orgullo y entusiasmo por el trabajo y la actitud de mucha iniciativa, dijo y agrego que este ardiente patriotismo de los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica le emociono mucho. 
					
					La Fabrica de Azulejo Taedonggang es la magna base de produccion de materiales de construccion, senalo y apunto la necesidad de aumentar la produccion y las variedades y mejorar la calidad. 
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Bok, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Ryong Ha, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho, Jang Su Gil y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige concierto de banda femenina del ESIPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige concierto de banda femenina del ESIPC
						
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) --El Mariscal  Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el concierto de la banda femenina de instrumentos de viento del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea (ESIPC). 
					El Mariscal Salio al palco junto con su esposa     Ri Sol Ju. 
					
					Tuvo lugar la ceremonia de entrada de la banda grabando la estrella de Mariscal al compas de la interpretacion vigorosa de la cancion "Mirennos". 
					
					En el concierto iniciado con las musicas de instrumentos de viento "!Flamea alto, bandera de nuestro Partido!" y "Gloria a nuestro gran Partido", se interpretaron diversas piezas como el solo de trompeta "Seguiremos con la unica alma", la musica de instrumentos de viento "Nuestro dirigente adorado por el pueblo", el cuarteto de instrumentos de viento-metal "General corre a caballo blanco", el solo de trombon "Mi patria que defiendo", la serie de canciones creadas en la pasada guerra coreana "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria", "El soldado y la muchacha", "Avance", "En el manantial", "Cancion de la madre" y "Nadie lo sabe", las musicas de instrumentos de viento "!Viva el Generalisimo    Kim Il Sung!" y "Cancion de agradecimiento", la musica de instrumentos de viento y danza ritmica "La juventud es el tren expreso", etc. 
					
					Los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patente el gran orgullo y dignidad del ESIPC que vive y lucha como combatiente revolucionario del partido y el lider y defensor del pueblo y manifestaron plenamente el poderio del ESIPC que defiende fidedignamente las conquistas de la patria socialista y la tranquilidad del pueblo en la primera linea de la lucha clasista. 
					
					A traves del cambio de formacion y los movimientos ritmicos vigorosos y especiales, el concierto demostro la probada capacidad de interpretacion de la banda. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo felicito con su mano alzada el exito de la funcion. 
					
					Se dio cuenta de los meritos orgullosos de la banda diciendo que en el pasado esta llamo a los oficiales y soldados del ESIPC y a los civiles a la batalla de defensa de la patria socialista y a la construccion de la patria prospera e hizo aporte a la marcha exitosa de importantes actividades. 
					
					Es bueno que la banda haya combinado la interpretacion de las musicas de instrumentos de viento con los movimientos ritmicos de caracter artistico, la razon por la cual la banda gana una buena reputacion popular, dijo e indico que debe crear de forma mas diversa e interesante los movimientos ritmicos. 
					
					Apunto que los creadores y ejecutantes de la banda no deben perder la naturaleza de la banda militar revolucionaria en la interpretacion incluso la formacion de programa y el arreglo musical, de acuerdo con su mision y caracter. 
					
					Los creadores y ejecutantes deben elevar las habilidades uniendo sus inteligencias y haciendo esfuerzos posibles para cumplir excelentemente la mision de la banda femenina de instrumentos de viento del ESIPC crecida en el regazo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					El Mariscal expreso la gran esperanza y la conviccion de que los creadores y ejecutantes de la banda llamaran a todos los militares y civiles al cumplimiento de la causa de la revolucion del Songun del Partido tocando con mas vigor la musica militar revolucionaria. 
					
					El fue acompanado en esta ocasion por Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Bok, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Ryong Ha, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho y Ma Won Chun.
